com.hilbertinc.base
Class HException

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Throwable
      java.lang.Exception
          com.hilbertinc.base.HException
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class HException
extends java.lang.Exception

This is the base exception class for all application-specific problems within Hilbert applications

See Also:

getOriginalException

public java.lang.Throwable getOriginalException()
This contains the java.lang.Throwable subclass that caused the Hilbert exception to be thrown. This may be null in many cases, but it gives exception handlers the opportunity to rethrow the original exception or to provide additional diagnostics

Returns:
java.lang.Throwable

isRecoverable

public boolean isRecoverable()
This indicates if the problem is transient and possibly will correct itself without intervention. Examples include a service at the other end of a socket that is not available. Non-recoverable errors would include a missing class such as a JDBC driver or a missing configuration file.

Returns:
boolean

setRecoverable

public void setRecoverable(boolean canRecover)
This indicates if the problem is transient and possibly will correct itself without intervention. Examples include a service at the other end of a socket that is not available. Non-recoverable errors would include a missing class such as a JDBC driver or a missing configuration file.

Parameters:
canRecover - boolean
